greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = 6*binomial(n,k) - 5 for 0 <= k <= n.
link: Indranil Ghosh, Rows 0..120 of triangle, flattened
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: T := proc (n, k) if k <= n then 6*binomial(n, k)-5 else 0 end if end proc: for n from 0 to 10 do seq(T(n, k), k = 0 .. n) end do; # _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 20 2007
program: (MAGMA) [6*Binomial(n,k) -5: k in [0..n], n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 12 2020
(Sage) [[6*binomial(n,k) -5 for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 12 2020
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jun 13 2007
